marketNews.title: MSCI Plans to Use KSEI Data for May 2026 Free Float Calculation
marketNews.content: MSCI announced it is seeking input from market participants regarding plans to use the Monthly Holding Composition Report published by KSEI as an additional reference in calculating the free float of Indonesian listed shares. Currently, issuers in Indonesia only report shareholders with ownership of â‰¥5% to the IDX, whereas KSEI data reports ownership based on shareholder classification, providing a more detailed picture of shareholders below 5%.Besides the plan to use the KSEI report as an additional reference, MSCI proposes that the free float estimate be determined based on the lowest value between: - The free float calculated using ownership data reported by issuers in disclosures, reports, and press releases, based on MSCI methodology; and - Proposed: The free float estimated based on KSEI data, by classifying script shares (not listed in KSEI data) and 'corporate' ownership (local and foreign) and 'others' (local and foreign) as non-free float. - Alternate: Alternatively, MSCI proposes a free float estimate based on KSEI data, by classifying script shares and 'corporate' ownership (excluding 'others') as non-free float.Note that this plan is not yet certain to be implemented and is still awaiting input from market participants. MSCI will receive input until December 31, 2025, with the results of the consultation to be announced before January 30, 2026. If the proposal is adopted, the changes will be implemented in the May 2026 index review.Key TakeawayGiven that this plan is not yet certain to be implemented and is still awaiting input from market participants, investors need to monitor further developments to be announced by MSCI. Based on simulations performed by MSCI as of September 30, 2025, generally, shares currently in the MSCI Indonesia index will experience a reduction in the Foreign Inclusion Factor (FIF), potentially leading to outflows. Changes in FIF and their impact on market cap under each scenario, namely 'proposed' and 'alternate', can be seen in the table above. Some highlights from the simulation are: 1) BBCA potentially experiences the largest outflow (no. 2 in the 'alternate' scenario) nominally, but not proportionally; 2) proportionally, GOTO potentially experiences the largest FIF reduction; and 3) DSSA becomes the only issuer that potentially experiences an FIF increase and receives inflows.

marketNews.title: Panicked MSCI: Fear or Opportunity?
marketNews.content: "Be wise in making decisions, don't rely solely on others' advice." - blackmon14

tickerNews.title: BMRI 9M25: Net Profit Drops -10% YoY, In Line with Expectations
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri recorded a net profit of 13.3 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (-14% YoY, +18% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 37.7 trillion rupiah (-10% YoY), equivalent to 75% of the 2025F consensus estimate (vs. 9M24: 75% realization for 2024). Generally, the performance in 3Q25 followed the trend of 9M25, with net profit declining year-on-year due to: 1) Pre-Provision Operating Profit falling by -9%/-7% YoY in 3Q25/9M25 due to a rise in opex (+25% YoY) amidst Net Interest Income (NII) growing only in the low-single digits; and 2) an increase in provision expenses of +22%/+10% YoY in 3Q25/9M25. Loan growth reached +11% YoY as of September 2025, above management's 2025 guidance in the range of +8-10% YoY.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Net Profit for 9M25 Reaches $104 Million, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy recorded a net profit of 35 million US dollars in 3Q25 (-6% YoY, -6% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 104 million US dollars (-22% YoY), below expectations as it equates to 67% of the 2025F consensus estimate. Although revenue grew solidly in 3Q25 (+12% YoY, +10% QoQ), the overall profit margin was pressured due to a surge in the cost of revenue (+34% YoY, +41% QoQ) and an increase in operating expenses to 9 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: 2 million US dollars; 2Q25: 9 million US dollars). The increase in the cost of revenue was mainly caused by an increase in depreciation expense (+18% YoY, +8% QoQ) and a jump in wages and benefits expenses to 21 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: 9 million US dollars; 2Q25: 5 million US dollars).

tickerNews.title: KLBF 9M25 Net Profit Grows +11% YoY to IDR 2.63 Trillion, In Line with Expectations
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma recorded a net profit of 656 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+15% YoY, -27% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 2.63 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY), in line with expectations (74% of 2025F consensus estimate vs. 2-year average: 74% annual realization). The year-on-year growth in 3Q25 net profit was mainly driven by revenue growth (+13% YoY) with all business segments experiencing growth, especially the 'consumer health' segment (+19% YoY) and 'distribution & logistics' segment (+19% YoY). Meanwhile, the operating profit margin expanded year-on-year to 9.7% in 3Q25 (vs. 3Q24: 9.0%), supported by a gross profit margin increase (+110 bps YoY) and more moderate opex growth (+14% YoY) compared to gross profit growth (+16% YoY).

tickerNews.title: DRMA 9M25 Net Profit Increased by +2% YoY to IDR 420 Billion Amidst Revenue Growth
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal recorded a net profit of 180 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+3% YoY, +84% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 420 billion rupiah (+2% YoY). In 3Q25/9M25, revenue grew +10%/+9% YoY, but the decline in scrap income (-9%/-10% YoY) and other non-exchange income (-44%/-12% YoY) caused net profit growth to be lower than revenue growth.In a separate disclosure, DRMA announced that the company is currently finalizing documentation and legal processes to acquire 82% of PT Mah Sing Indonesia shares. The value of this proposed transaction has not been announced. This transaction plan is aimed at expanding the company's business activities, especially in the plastic component business for four-wheeled vehicles.

tickerNews.title: PADA (was INET) Negotiating Acquisition of 53.57% of Personel Alih Daya Shares
tickerNews.content: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima (INET) announced that it is undergoing negotiation processes to acquire 53.57% of Personel Alih Daya shares from the Indosat Employee Cooperative. The value of this proposed transaction has not been announced. After this transaction is completed, INET will become the new controller of PADA. As of the end of September 2025, the Indosat Employee Cooperative held 59.86% of PADA shares.

tickerNews.title: MARK Plans to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Book Year of IDR 76 Billion
tickerNews.content: Mark Dynamics Indonesia plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 book year amounting to 76 billion rupiah or 20 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 3% as of Monday (27/10). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is November 5, 2025, while payment will be on November 27, 2025. This is the second interim dividend for the 2025 book year from MARK, following the interim dividend of 20 rupiah per share distributed in August 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Secured New Contract Value of IDR 16.88 Trillion in 9M25
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of PT PP, Joko Raharjo, told Kontan that the company recorded a new contract value of 16.88 trillion rupiah during 9M25 (-18.8% YoY), equivalent to ~59% of the 2025 target of 28.5 trillion rupiah. According to the source, the acquisition of new contracts during 9M25 originated 47.05% from State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), 28.93% from private entities, and 24.02% from the government.

tickerNews.title: US CPI Inflation Decreased in September 2025 Compared to August 2025 and Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics noted that overall Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in the US decreased in September 2025 compared to August 2025 and was below expectations. CPI inflation in September 2025 rose to 3% YoY (vs. August 2025: 2.9% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation of 3.1% YoY. Month-on-month, CPI inflation was recorded at 0.3% MoM (vs. consensus: 0.4% MoM; August 2025: 0.4% MoM). Meanwhile, core inflation rose to 3% YoY (vs. consensus: 3.1% YoY; August 2025: 3.1% YoY).

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump suggested the decision on the next Fed Chair might be made by year-end 2025
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said that a decision regarding the next Fed Chair might be announced by the end of 2025. Meanwhile, US Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, stated that five potential Fed Chair candidates are under consideration: Trump aide Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Christopher Waller, Fed Vice Chair Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock executive Rick Rieder. Jerome Powell's current term as Fed Chair is set to end in May 2026.

tickerNews.title: US and China Agreed on a Potential Trade Deal Framework
tickerNews.content: US Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, stated that the US and China have agreed on a framework for a potential trade deal, which will be discussed by President Donald Trump and President Xi Jinping when they meet in South Korea this weekend. Bessent stated that he expects Trump will not impose an additional 100 percentage point tariff on China, and anticipates an extension of the tariff implementation postponement past the deadline on November 10, 2025. Bessent mentioned that the trade deal framework includes agreements related to TikTok's operations in the US, the suspension of China's strict controls on rare earth minerals, and the continuation of China's purchases of US soybeans.

tickerNews.title: Government Preparing New Presidential Regulation for Online Motorcycle Taxis (ojol)
tickerNews.content: Minister of State Secretariat, Prasetyo Hadi, stated that the government is preparing a Presidential Regulation to regulate online motorcycle taxis (ojol), covering tariffs, protection, and welfare for the ojol drivers. Prasetyo mentioned that the regulation is still under discussion, but there is a possibility of being issued this year. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto said last week that the government has held discussions with two ride-hailing companies in Indonesia to ensure job security for their drivers and prevent detrimental competition.

tickerNews.title: Waste-to-Energy Power Plant Projects in Tangerang City and South Tangerang Canceled, Consolidated into Jatiwaringin TPA Project
tickerNews.content: Minister of Environment, Hanif Faisol Nurofiq, stated that the government canceled the waste management into electrical energy (PSEL) projects in Tangerang City and South Tangerang, based on the decision of President Prabowo Subianto in Presidential Regulation No. 109/2025. Instead, Hanif explained that the PSEL projects in the two cities will be merged into a PSEL project centralized at the Jatiwaringin landfill (TPA) in Tangerang Regency. According to Bisnis records, the PSEL project in Tangerang City was handled by PT Oligo Infra Swarna Nusantara, while the PSEL project in South Tangerang was handled by PT Indoplas Energi Hijau, a subsidiary of Maharaksa Biru Energi (OASA) and China Tianying Inc.

tickerNews.title: HEAL: President Director Yulisar Khiat Conducted Share Grant, Commissioner Hasmoro Bought Shares
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL), Yulisar Khiat, conducted a share grant of approximately 680 million (4.44%) shares on October 21-23, 2025, causing Yulisar Khiat's direct ownership portion in HEAL to decrease from 10.37% to 5.93%. In a separate transaction, the President Commissioner of HEAL, Hasmoro, purchased 900,000 HEAL shares on October 20-22, 2025, at an average price of ~1,495 rupiah per share, totaling approximately 1.35 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hasmoro's direct ownership portion in HEAL increased, but remains around ~4.84%.

tickerNews.title: BUVA Changes Rights Trading Period and Updates Rights Issue Fund Allocation
tickerNews.content: Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA) announced that the rights trading period changed from October 31 - November 6, 2025, to November 7 - November 13, 2025. Furthermore, BUVA updated the allocation plan for the rights issue proceeds as follows: 1) 416 billion rupiah (69%) to settle the remaining payment for the acquisition of 99.99% of PT Bukit Permai Properti (BPP) shares; 2) 108 billion rupiah (18%) for land purchase and development in Pecatu, Bali; and 3) 76.6 billion rupiah (13%) for additional capital injection into BPP no later than 4Q25, which BPP will use for land purchase in Pecatu, Bali.
